comment: In my 30-year career, I’ve more never been proud and honored to carry and give a business card.
They will have to burn the building down before I will leave...and even then, I may just work in the ashes.
I’m surrounded by people who want to work and who love what they do. The energy that comes from that is like magic in a bottle.
This is the second love of my life.
I have been an employee here for 45 years and will stay to my last moments.

For personal reasons I have been forced to seek employment in another state, and will probably need to leave. This makes me incredibly sad, as it really is the best place to work. After many interviews, I can already see that other companies will not have nearly the same benefits and culture as my company. Even my management, when I told them that I needed to start looking elsewhere, were happy to offer whatever assistance they could in helping me. They are even considering opening a new branch office in the city where I need to go. How much better can a company be??
Happy employees don't go looking for other opportunities
These folks walk the walk. Seriously. Truly a company of great people.
Having this job has changed my life
I’ve been working for this company for only two years, and I can honestly say that I do see this company as my last employer.
What I cherish is that everyone takes this on with the same vigor and ‘make it happen’ spirit, so you’re never alone in your daily efforts. One team, one goal!
I feel challenged to put forth my best work 100% of the time and know that the success of the company rests on all of our shoulders.

This company is amazing. One of the things I truly appreciate is that leaders are primarily focused on finding only the best people to join the team. They take the time to hire intelligent, driven, and creative individuals, and it’s a pleasure working alongside each and every one of them.
This office is without question closer than some families.
There is never a day that goes by without at least one senior manager asking me how I am doing. That in itself is awesome!

I have been with my company for 20 years. Most of my coworkers in my immediate group have been here 10-30 years! The tenure is long because we work for a company that appreciates us and rewards us daily both in the type of work that we do and the benefits and pay we receive.
I cannot think of a better, more efficiently-run company to work for. I have been here 25 years and every year has been awesome!!!

The interviewing process here was extensive, but I realize the importance of finding just the right person to not only to fit the criteria for work, but as a person. I am truly blessed to be a part of a place like this!

I have a lot of friends that have gone to other organizations thinking the grass is always greener. I’m amazed at how regularly they say, ‘I made a mistake’ or ‘I wish I could come back.’ Having the perspective of working for different companies before coming here eight years ago, I can happily say that there’s no place I’d rather be.
I’m honored to work for a company that lives the values it places on the walls.
This is really the best place I’ve ever worked. My team is great. My boss is great. The work is great. And, I can still make time for my private life, friends, and family. It doesn’t get any better.

I have only worked here for a little over two years, but my coworkers are like my family. They have mentored me, helped me grow, and watched me succeed as well as fail. I feel more than a professional attachment to this company - I feel a personal attachment.
There is a genuine spirit of camaraderie here. We enjoy working hard and playing hard together. We laugh, share joyous moments, and share in grief when tragedy touches one of our own.

Our leaders are focused on finding only the best people to join the team. They take time to hire intelligent, driven, and creative individuals, and it’s a pleasure working alongside each and every one of them.

This organization is the best work environment that I have ever had the privilege of being associated with. The management team cares about their employees and about the business as a whole. The work done at this organization is breathtaking and amazing.
This organization does not care about the employees.
I want out.
It honestly feels as if the company wants us to leave, and if we don’t leave on our own accord the company will force us to eventually.
It’s very hard to come to work every day with a smile on your face when you know your work counts for nothing except for management’s bonuses and pizza or ice cream or something totally insulting.
Talent is leaking out of this company.
Some people are actually afraid of management
This company is too unpredictable. I always feel layoffs are around the corner.
This is not a best place to work. The senior leadership lacks ethics and morals.
Please consider researching the amount of employees who are out on medical leave... Aka stress leave.
Morale in our company is very low employees are having nightmares and are afraid to come to work.

Where i come from actions speak louder than words you can talk about valuing employees all you want, but when you lay people off, give them little to no raises, and spend your time and effort praising fake successes, it rings hollow.
This company is part of a long downhill death
If you aren’t in the in crowd, good luck. They only promote those they can manipulate
Stop firing people under the pretense of reorganization only to post those same positions.
Keep your mouth shut, show up, & don't rock the boat
The VP of HR does not give her time for anyone, as if she is god. We beg for opportunities to speak with her, and we are ignored.
There is a lot of nepotism & favoritism at this company. Paths to

Advancement is unclear. It appears to be primarily a buddy system. It is so bad, that I’ve gotten to the point where i no longer hope for advancement and have decided to just consider this a means to an end.
This place sucks! They do not care about customers or employees. It is not safe for customers because management is cutting corners.
Please get our place clean. It is filthy and has been for the past year. I am embarrassed to have anyone know i work in such a filthy place. And you ask if this is the best place to work? Please.
Upper management in my office tends to talk down to employees, and has a mindset that all employees are replaceable.
I am nothing but a number here.
My manager mistreats the staff and bullies people when she is in a bad mood and targets people. That is why people have left. I wish someone in management would help us.
My managers/supervisor treat us like we’re robots we are real humans...with lives and families outside of work.
This is the best company I’ve worked at, because we believe in people over profits.
The benefits that come from working here are above and beyond the monetary rewards we receive.
I have received more positive feedback and recognition here than anywhere else in my life. My personal confidence level has gone up considerably. I love it here!
While the workload and responsibilities are on the higher end, we are consistently rewarded with praise, company successes, customer compliments, and feedback.
Management gives constructive criticism when it’s needed and praise when it’s due.
I appreciate the small incentives general kindness, and thank you for a job well done.
Lack of recognition is not an issue here.
We celebrate work achievements like they’re birthday parties.
Senior management talks with us to find out what motivates us to strive for company goals. They use those means of motivation to show that they really care about their employees.
You know you’ve done something right when your manager gives you an atta’ boy!
I have a great supervisor who listens and considers my thoughts and ideas.
Leadership genuinely cares about each one of us & strives to provide us with practical guidance & an atmosphere in which we can succeed & be happy.
Promotions are given to people who earn it, despite seniority.
They treat you like a person rather than a subordinate.
They show that although I’m not perfect, I’m still a great asset who they appreciate.
We’re given the training to learn, the tools to do our jobs, and the opportunity to advance within the company.
We make recognition fun with silly awards like most energetic on Mondays and best barista.
Recognition is a constant reminder that we’re headed in the right direction.
Management cares about people and shows it. We are given the tools we need to get the job done.
I often receive positive feedback from senior management. I’m just grateful they take the time to recognize me.
I absolutely love working for this company. My direct manager empowers me and shows her appreciation for my work ethic regularly.
You work hard and get compensated praise, promotion, and genuine for appreciation.
My employer does so much to make every employee feel like an essential component to the company’s success. I’d just like to say thanks.
I always feel appreciated.
Good work never goes unnoticed.
We’re led by power-hungry individuals who are all-too willing to punish & oppress subordinates.
It’s not what you do, it’s what people think you do. Try to take credit for other people’s work.

As time has passed, I’ve become more and more convinced that i am invisible. My manager does not care about my growth or development at all. I am very much looking forward to finding a job with a different company.
As an employee, i don’t feel valued.
Would a ‘thank you’ be so hard?
Please, please, please just treat me like a human being.
Threatening termination is not the kind of attention employees want.
Quit treating us like elementary kids! We’re adults; give us real appreciation.
There is absolutely no motivation to try when only ‘in-crowd’ employees get promoted.
I’ve never been told that I’m doing a good job.
Hard workers are not appreciated. They simply get used.
Leadership does a terrible job of noticing, let alone recognizing, employees. There’s no incentive anymore.
Managers don’t care about effort; they only care if the work gets done.
Recognition is given to those who put in the most hours, not those who do the best work.
It seems as though threats of error are the normal means of motivation.
We just go through the motions so we don’t get yelled at and can get home by five.
Employees are rewarded for throwing coworkers under the bus; no wonder our culture blows.
Human assets are of zero value.
I’m sick of employees with poor reviews receiving the same benefits as those with great reviews.
It’s all about money and numbers here. People aren’t the most important thing anymore.
Overworked. Unappreciated. Underpaid.
If I contribute to the organization’s success, I know I will be recognized, said no one at this company, ever.
There are too many slackers getting paid more than me.
Management needs to value everyone, regardless of position or tenure. We are all valuable, and we should be treated that way.
Employees here are treated as expendable.
When asked what the company could improve on: nothing. They’ve honed the art of this business down to a science.
I can’t say enough good things about this place.
I have been in this business for over 20 years. This is, without a doubt, the best atmosphere and most rewarding place I have ever had the opportunity in which to work.
I feel more at home, more comfortable, more in control, and more supported than i ever have before.
This is such an amazing company led by incredible leaders.
This job is unique & rewarding.
I love working for this company. When I first started, I thought it was too good to be true but later found out that it isn’t!
I feel like everyone’s opinion matters.
I can honestly say, “I love my job.”
I have the utmost respect for leadership and my coworkers.
I foresee long-term commitment and loyalty.
This is my home.
This will be the place I retire from.
This employer genuinely cares for your growth, both professionally and personally.
Working for this company is like working with family. We are strict, but loved.
This place is so fun! We get surprises all of the time.
It’s obvious management is doing everything possible to improve our workplace.
You’ll have to carry me out when I stop breathing.
I have been here about a year now, and I have not heard any grumbling about management or the company or even about co-workers. I love it!
It is an honor to work with such talented coworkers.
The environment here is intellectually stimulating. I am motivated to jump out of bed in the morning.
This job is truly a blessing.
I can’t imagine working anywhere else, ever.
Honesty and integrity are guiding principles. That mentality starts at the top and trickles down throughout the entire ofﬁce.
The bar for professionalism and productivity is very high, yet the feeling of caring for each employee runs deep.
Morons are running this place.
It’s like working for the gestapo.
Leadership comes with hidden agendas, which gives a sense of fear, disrespect, uncertainty, and distrust.
Leadership needs to step it up!
We keep finding new and innovative ways to be counter-productive.
Several recent business decisions have made me seriously question the integrity of the leaders at this organization.
“This company” and “productive workplace” don’t belong in the same sentence.
It's not about the people anymore; it's about how much money can be made.
Managers act like they’re entitled to everything, and we’re just expected to stand there and lick their boots.
The overall morale of employees could not be lower.
This office makes me feel like a bother.
You are the main reason I want to quit.
I am sick of working for these people.
They impose fear by telling us we are replaceable and disposable.
We do not care about you. You are lower than dirt.
It’s all I can do to make myself come to work in such a mismanaged environment.
This place sucks, but I have to stay. I just hope the leaders don’t eat up my pension and screw me after 30 years.
There are zero opportunities for promotion at this organization.
They’ve finally stopped the beating.
If the economy were better, I’d be out of here in a heartbeat.
Stop treating me like I’m stupid.
I can barely afford to work here anymore.
When I express my concerns, I hear, “there’s a line out the door of people qualified to do your job.”
Leadership gets pleasure out of us doing something wrong.
I can’t wait to get off this sinking ship.
